intro: Brunfelsia mire, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Brunfelsia mire is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
